text: ‚ñ∫Business Analysis/ Management Consulting course: taught by me and an ex-McKinsey consultant: https://wisdomhatch.com/management-consulting/
author: Akshat Shrivastava

text:
Ideally Govt should provide benefits to tax payers like Income loss benefits, Death benefits, illness benefits, retirement benefits etc. This is not complicated as it may sound. A small percentage of the tax you pay should be used to take a Insurance on your behalf & also to create a kitty like the pf to provide the benefits. 
The Covid crisis is a classic example wherein many people overnight lost their incomes- both salaried & business class. Inspite of them having paid lakhs or crores as taxes previously, they didn't get any benefit when they were in crisis! 
I know many whose CIBIL score has been damaged because they haven't even got a moratorium benefit
author: The Money Insights

text: Hi Akshat, I really appreciate your videos. However, this comparison does not make sense to me. We should not compare a developed, wealthy country like Norway to India. Norway is a resource rich country, its revenue from oil and gas exports alone is USD 11.5 billion per month and the counrty's population has a right on those resources in a way through the sovereign fund. Hence, it makes sense for the govt. to support its population, while they can clearly afford to do so.
author: barbie majumdar

text: As noble it may sound, I feel it should not be implemented in India. Our politicians are not so sensible to see its long term adverse effects on our society and economy in its current state. It will simply be used as a political tool just like 1000 cr subsidies and renumeration we already give out only to appease votebanks. India is already enough of a welfare state. With introduction of UBI and things like these our great politicians will run the coffers dry within a decade.

text: Akshat, it is not only about jobs. The government should also pay "traffic tax" as the infrastructure it plans never supports the number of new vehicle brands they allow to sell their vehicles in India. Rather due to huge traffic, we consumers end up burning far more fuel and total cost of ownership goes up. It also leads to long traffic jams, loss of productivity, road rage, accidents etc etc. So government should also pay "poor infrastructure tax". There are many other taxes that the government should pay but let's keep it to these two as of now. Hope this makes sense.

When we are young we work and pay tax to govt so I think govt should pay a reasonable percent of tax so that we can survive with respect because sometime our do not support us monetarily or physically during our old age so govt should give pension to govt or pvt sector employees. Thank you

text:
If you buy anything pay tax.
If you buy a house pay tax.
If you buy stocks , pay tax.
If you buy crypto(XD 30%) pay tax.
If you take loan to start a business then pay huge interest. 
If you earn more than 15 lakhs a year then pay 30% tax.
If you somehow fail to run your business or something happens to you then government will simply ignore you. WOW. No help from government but pay taxes immediately. I wonder what is our government even doing with these huge amount of tax money. Oh. Statue. I completely forgot about it.
author: EvolutionOfGames

text: Income tax payers in India have to create themselves one coordinated group to fight for their tax rights. Most elected persons are corrupt, so don't expect  anything from them. Elected persons have got easy access to loot Income tax payers without giving anything in return like - Good hospital access  without payment, job loss pay and  old age pension based on lifetime tax paid. Income tax can also be said as illegal tax! You work hard, you earn more-they tax more - but govt has no liability. After paying income tax - people have finance their kids education, high medical bills and old age pensions. They why paying Income tax !

...and the list goes on
